summary: REQ-1 and REQ-2 appear to be implemented via updates to the central content source (artistContent) including JensyPragya identity/bio and the exact YouTube URL, and the footer consumes the YouTube link from artistContent.social.youtube. The diff also introduces additional navigation/attribution behavior in the footer and updates project_state tracking that were not requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Footer “smart navigation” behavior (section scrolling vs navigating to home, plus a dedicated /listen navigation handler) beyond the requested content updates.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest only asked to update draft content (artist identity + YouTube video/link) via the central content source; it did not request new navigation logic.

hallucinated_features.description: Caffeine.ai attribution with UTM tracking and computed appIdentifier/fallback hostname logic in the footer.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by REQ-1/REQ-2; unrelated to updating artist bio/video content.

hallucinated_features.description: Updates to project tracking state (new_feature_requests statuses, known issues, etc.) in project_state.json.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest does not mention altering internal project metadata/state files.
